name: UI Flow Shorthand Component Template V. 1.1.
description:
What it is:

This template is a tool for quick user flow ideation.


It's based on the "UI Flow Shorthand" technique as published by Ryan Singer. Reading this 5 minute read is highly recommended.


The shorthand method can help you:

  • "to get a flow out of my brain in order to move on to other things" - Ryan Singer (article above)
  • to jot down user flows quickly
  • to discuss user flows early in the process
  • to avoid distraction that result from how it looks


How to use:

Set the component as needed (e.g. display bullet, number of "What people do" steps, display of an extra header ...)


Connect them with arrow (paths):

  1. Self-drawn arrows
  2. Copying components to Figjam and work with connectors (Note: Figma currently does not offer connectors natively in Figma - only in Figjam)
  3. Experimental format with Auto-Layout connectors in the file


Update Version 1.1.

  • Tidying up
  • New Element: Decision Point

Limitations:

Connecting to components in Figma with a path still comes with some sort of workaround.


Method credit:

Ryan Singer
